215040.name: Bunny Zap
215040.description:
From casette inlay
The giant rabbits are out to get you, but luckily you have got a hyper-accurate Bunny Zapping laser! Your laser bolts will bounce off the walls of the warrens and you are only allowed one at a time.
Bonus points and levels adcances can be achieved by capturing the green cosmic creatures

215044.name: Eagle Empire
215044.description:
From casette inlay
Arcade action at its very best. Fight your way through 4 tension ridden levels of attack from the menacing phoenix and battle armed eagles, before you can reach the heavily armoured and strongle defended Eagle Empire. Blast a path through the defensice shield to destroy this evil force and if you complete your mission unscathed, you are rewarded with a further attemot even more difficult than the last.
Extra lives at 10,000 points, 30,000 points, 50,000 points, etc.

215045.name: UNCHARTED: The Lost Legacy
215045.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Next UNCHARTED game.

215046.name: Marvel vs. Capcom: Infinite
215046.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Next Marvel vs. Capcom game.

215047.name: Killer Watt
215047.description:
From casette inlay
Explore the dark depts of the underground cavarn. Patrol the eerie passages of this totally enclosed world. Seek out and destroy the 12 brilliant light bulbs, blasters at the ready to ward off the dangers of flying men, armed with deadly bombs, carnivours flying fish, and marauding mechanical birds and their devastating eggs. Having succesfully manoeuvred your patrol vehicle through this hazadous test of skill, your path to the next level of difficulty is barred by the magical gateway, and you must fire at will to blast your way through the next challange of death.
Superb, smooth scroll action with high resolution graphics and imaginative sound effects.

215048.name: Knack 2
215048.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Sequel to Knack.

215049.name: Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony
215049.description:
The game continues the same style of gameplay as the first two Danganronpa games, in which the player must participate in Class Trials to determine who among their fellow students murdered one of their own.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danganronpa_V3%3A_Killing_Harmony Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

215050.name: The Last of Us Part II
215050.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Sequel to The Last of Us.

215051.name: MLB The Show 17
215051.description:
It will be the twelfth entry of the MLB: The Show franchise.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MLB_The_Show_17 MLB The Show 17]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

215052.name: Ace Combat 7
215052.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Next game in the Ace Combat series.

215053.name: Don't Get Bit in the Mead Hall: Zombie Expansion
215053.description:
This is an expansion for "Don't Fall in the Mead Hall" and requires that game to play. The "Allies and Drunk Guys" expansion is not needed but strongly recommended.

There are many stories in the Icelandic sagas about an undead creature called the draugr, or aptrgangr (lit. "after-goer," "again-walker," or "one who walks after death"). Most would call them zombies in this day and age and they have found the Mead Hall! Think you have what it takes to keep playing? Well go and prove your mettle once again. But this time you must fend off zombies as you out drink your Viking opponents.

You will send zombies to other tables, fight zombies, and summon zombies. Just don't fall OR get bit in the Mead Hall!

Each time you get bit the sickness at your table gets worse and you lose a heart. If you get bit when you have no hearts one of your Vikings will turn into a Zombie and stay at your table as a threat.

Also included are two zombie themed Tipsy cards that you can add to your Tipsy deck if you have the Allies expansion.

The Last table with at least one Viking standing is the winner.

215054.name: Krawall im Stall
215054.description:
Description from the back of the box:

"There seems to be a lot going on down on the farm. The farmer accidentally left the barn door open and now the animals are all loose. With great difficulty he's managed to catch them all but now the barn is in uproar. Can you help sort the animals?

An exciting memory game with lots of animals that can also be played with as a farm set once the game is over.

Players mix up the 32 wooden animals (4 each of 8 different animals) and place them into the 8 barns. Players then take turns trying to find pairs of the animals, until all of the animals are matched. The player who found the most pairs wins.

215055.name: THOTH
215055.description:
THOTH is a challenging twin-stick shooter you can conquer alone or cooperatively with a friend. Each stage is handcrafted to test coordination and puzzle-solving skills. Colorful minimalist graphics combine with an intense unnerving soundtrack, making for an exciting mix of art and arcade.

Source: The Developer Website.

215056.description: A new role that replaces the Dragon. The Nightmare Unicorn will run around the board attacking and teleporting until it brings the Cave down on you. Stop it while you can.
215056.name: Vast: The Crystal Caverns – Nightmare Unicorn

215058.name: Sonhando com Alice
215058.description:
Sonhando
Sonhando com Alice or (Dreaming with Alice) is a Dice Rolling and Set Collection game, you need to score the most victory points to win. The game is set in the Alice in Wonderland theme.

Each player rolls 6 dice and choose one of the actions in the game board. To do the action you pick all the dice for that action at once. The more dice you get better is the action.

215059.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 21 - Check Please)
215059.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This Week: We have a great new adventure for your heroes, so join the fun.

215060.name: Deadly Dragonkin
215060.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world's most famous fantasy role-playing game has many official monsters, but many creatures we loved in prior editions have been overlooked. The 5e Fiendopedia brings some of these back and updates them for the 5th edition rules.

This PDF includes 6 new dragon relatives: Dracolisk; Drake, Desert; Drake, Flame; Drake, Frost; Drake, Sea; Drake, Shadow

Each creature gets a full-color image, 5th edition statistics & abilities, and background/ecology information.

215061.name: Death Wish
215061.description:
From publisher blurb:

While loss can be a great deterrent, it is an even better motivator. The day Jack lost everything he cared about, he became motivated to see his enemies feel his pain. Armed with an arsenal and the knowledge to use it, Jack has become a weapon against injustice. Those who think themselves above the law have every reason to fear Death Wish.

215062.name: When Goblins Die, No Comets are Seen (Pathfinder)
215062.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 Characters Levels 3-4

After delving into the upper tunnels of a recently-abandoned mine pursuing mutated goblins, the party follows some buckled minecart rails, finding rough tunnels and unexpected chambers at their end. A palpable sense of fear pervades the area.

The last members of a decimated tribe fled into these depths, but have no idea what to do now. They reached Area 5, but felt the sudden appearance of a worked room meant more trouble. Infamous amongst their kind, and fearing an unheralded death, they’re currently psyching themselves to fight back to the surface.

215063.name: Bahamut Gate
215063.description:
Fun, fast-playing cooperative game that that reduces the fantasy RPG experience to fighting a climactic boss battle by rolling dice and playing spell cards. Comes with five characters and five sealed scenarios; stands up to replaying well.

The boss stays in an octagon in the centre, and is surrounded by eight spaces that may be occupied by players, or in higher levels fire or minions. Each turn consists of a player phase and a boss phase.

In the player phase, the player on turn rolls 4d6, and rerolls up to 2d6 once. The dice serve two functions: first, they designate through character-specific tables which actions (move, draw spell cards, heal, etc.) or spells you can take; second, the largest set of identical dice determines how much damage you do to the boss.

In the boss phase, the boss rotates either two 45° steps or to face a player. The current player rolls 3d6, discards the high die, and looks up the two lower dice in a table to determine which octants take how much damage.

215064.name: Grand Hall
215064.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 40 x 40 inch, full color battlemap of a Grand Hall.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions, the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT) and include a 360 degree view of the hall from the centre.

“This is truly a grand hall worthy of a great king such as yourself milord.”—Obsequious King’s Attendant

Grand Hall is an interior map of a throne room. The main entrance is in the north which has a red-purple carpet that extends from the northern edge of the map through a curved double door to the southern throne on a raised dais. The hall can also be entered from west or east rectangular double doors that can lead to other areas in the palace. This map includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the center of the grand hall.

Grand Hall is intended for use in fantasy or horror games. It could also be an interesting map as a pulp historical site to explore in a modern game.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Last Accolades: The king has sent for his brave soldiers that have brought him victory against the southern barbarians. When they arrive they find meat being roasted on spits above the braziers and many casks of ale and bottles of wine have been brought forth for a grand feast. The king gives a speech about the great honor the soldiers have attained on the battlefield and gives them an accolade making them full knights.

However, the mad king fears the popularity of such heroes and thinks that with enough victories they may become too popular and turn on him to usurp his throne. He gives them a final meal with debilitating poisons in the meat applied by their servers in addition to slowing their reflexes and dulling their minds with alcohol.

After the king makes his grand exit just before midnight, men in the garb of the southern barbarians suddenly enter the room. The palace guards lock the doors behind them. The player characters are intended to die “protecting the king from barbarian assassins.” The player characters have to fight off the assassins and somehow escape with their exits barred while possibly being poisoned and drunk. If they survive, the player characters will certainly want revenge on the king and be willing to try and take over through civil war, assassination, or other means like trying to ally with their former enemies to the south in the barbarians.

215065.name: 75 Gnom' Street
215065.description:
Description from the publisher:

When Mamie leaves her cozy house, her garden becomes the battleground for a secret and terrible war between gangs of dwarves, with all of them searching for buried treasure before the owner returns home!

75 Gnom' Street is a game of investigation and bluffing, with each player trying to guess the location of the other gangs' spoils and hoping that they won't be able to find your treasures in return.

215066.name: Gang Rush Breakout
215066.description:
Description from the publisher:

When the members of the underworld start to cross the bridge that leads to their headquarters, nobody knows who will reach the other side. Dash, crash, and cash in Gang Rush Breakout — whoever meets the Godfather with the most loot wins!

215067.name: Savage Swords of Athanor (v3.0)
215067.description:
A Rules Supplement and Campaign Setting

From the introduction:

This supplement for Swords & Wizardry includes rules variants, new monsters, new races, and a new character class. Inside these pages a variant magic system, a simple psychic powers system, combat options, and a simple skill system. This book is also a guide to the Savage Swords of Athanor campaign, a mix of swords and sorcery, planetary romance, and horror elements all in a single pulpy package.

215068.name: The Culling of Wolves
215068.description:
From the introduction:

You have been told by one of the town guards that the mayoress wants to see you at the town hall at 3pm...

User summary:

For a party of three characters from 5th - 9th level. The scenario is distributed with three eight-page PDF character sheets containing pre-generated statistics.

boardgameintegration: Steal The Show! Act II: Theatrical Party Card Game
Steal The Show! Act II: Theatrical Party Card Game
215069.description:
Who will be the star of the show? Play as iconic characters as you challenge players to a Battle of Strength or a Battle of Wits using Shakespearean insults and the art of bluffing!

Steal The Show! is a race to collect five comedy masks, and the first player to do so wins. If a player receives five tragedy masks first, however, they're eliminated from the game. In more detail, each player takes on the role of a character. Characters have unique gameplay abilities as well as a strength value (used in a Battle of Strength) and a wit value (used in a Battle of Wits). One location card is always in play and changes throughout the course of the game; location cards modify the rules of the game.

Action cards (Insults) are used during battle to enhance the strength and wit value of the character as well as insert some trickery to mix! Don't forget bluffing! Players can use bluffing techniques to assist with a numerical boost as well!
215069.name: Steal The Show! Theatrical Party Card Game

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215070.name: Precious Cargo
215070.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Module

From the introduction:

A representative of King Kimbertos Skotti of Keoland needs you to provide an armed escort for a carriage traveling from Niole Dra to Redlee Manor in the Shelspring Barony. Certainly there can’t be much danger in that.

A Keoland introductory module for first-level characters only.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215071.name: Stuck Between a Rook and a Hard Place
215071.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

When the favorite chess set of the Earl of Linth is stolen, some fledgling heroes are charged with its recovery. But what does this have to do with... flumphs?

This adventure is an introductory module for 1st-level characters.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215072.name: Escape From Waldon Mountain
215072.description:
An Introductory Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Pa Waldon dreams of rebuilding the family tavern. But the area is off limits ever since those strange men in black rode into town. What secrets are they hiding up on Waldon Mountian?

An introductory adventure for 1st level characters.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215073.name: Runaway Bride
215073.description:
An Introductory Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Invitations have been sent. The Decorations are in place. Guests are starting to arrive, but the bride is nowhere to be found. The Lord of Montvale has summoned all available bodies to find his daughter. Will your group of stalwart companions be able to find her before it's too late?

An introductory adventure for 1st level characters.

215074.name: Hide and Seek
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215074.description:
A Three-Round Living Greyhawk Introductory Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A plot from within threatens the Kingdom of Keoland. Every hand holds a knife; behind every smile is the promise of murder. Can the heroes unravel a mystery and shed light on a plot that threatens the very Kingdom?

This adventure is an introductory module for 1st-level characters only.

This adventure is the prelude to the All Good Things story arc.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215075.name: Hool Goes There?
215075.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Module

From the introduction:

A madman with unspeakable knowledge is missing from the village of Waycombe. Can you stop the would-be plunderers before they unwittingly uncover an ancient horror?

A Keoland introductory module for first level characters and the prelude to the Sakatha Returns! story arc.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215076.name: Fast Times at Ravonnar High
215076.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

On the northwestern border of Keoland a solitary fortress stands a lonely watch against the ever-present enemies of Keoland. Only a very few choose to call Ravonnar their home. Some come out of duty to their kingdom or their Order. Some come seeking fame and fortune across the Javan or in the abandoned ruins of the Rushmoors. Others come with a still darker purpose. And not all are quite as they may appear...

A Keoland introductory adventure for 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215077.name: The Unwanted Ones
215077.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Charity and mercy beg assistance to help one who is too weak to help themselves. Can you find a home for the unwanted one?

An introductory Keoland regional adventure for 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215078.name: Clearing Out the Chapterhouse
215078.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

You received an urgent summons from the Headmaster of the Seaton Chapterhouse of the National Academy of Wizardry. But what task can novice adventurers complete that Keoland's most accomplished wizards cannot?

A Keoland Introductory module that answers the nagging question about just what happened to all those abandoned toad familiars. For 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215079.name: Forest of Iron
215079.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

Loggers are disappearing, interrupting the retrieval of the Ironwood, and Lord High Admiral Duke Luschan Sellark Rhola VIII of Gradsul is not pleased. What appeared to be an isolated incident in a small village on the Dreadverge is suddenly revealed to be part of something much larger. The locals of Anglar are not willing to present themselves to the dangers of the Dreadwood for mere gold - are you?

A Keoland introductory regional adventure for first level characters only.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215080.name: Wasteland
215080.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

The last few years have seen the Earldom of Linth has been blasted by both physical confrontation and spiritual assault. After a forced evacuation, the court of the land has declared Linth to be habitable again, and a stream of people has started to return to their lands. However, the returning refugees are finding that not everyone left Linth, and that life in the Earldom is about to change.

Note: This adventure is playable by first level characters only.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215081.name: A New Breed
215081.description:
A Three-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

It is early spring, and it’s Growfest. You’ve heard that brewmaster Pemlo Penchant (of Pemlo’s Lambic fame, the Draught of Kings) is looking for some help collecting some ingredients of a secret new brew he is planning on concocting this very season. Maybe you can aid Pemlo in his preparation this time, like the other famous heroes did in 592 C.Y.

A Keoland three-round regional introductory adventure for level one characters only.

User summary:

See also KEO2-08: Pemlo's Lambic.

215082.name: Floris
215082.description:
Players in Floris collect flower cards to create bouquets — but they need to use every card in hand in order to offer that bouquet for points.

To set up, shuffle the deck, lay five cards in the shape of an X, then stack the deck nearby. On a turn, a player can either take the center card of the X, two outer cards in the X (as long as they're adjacent), or one or two face-up cards from the personal supply of an opponent. After doing this, the player either adds those cards to hand or places them face-up in their own personal supply. The player can then add any number of cards from their personal supply to their hand.

If the player can then make a bouquet of all the cards in hand and their cards contain at least five flowers, they can score if they wish. The cards must show all the same flower, or all types of flowers must be represented in equal numbers (e.g., three lilies and three roses), or at least three types of flowers in ascending numerical order (e.g., one daisy, two roses and three lilies). If the player hands in nine or more flowers, they gain bonus points in addition to one point for each flower.

When the market runs out, players score a final bouquet, then lose points for cards left in hand. Whoever has the highest score wins!

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215083.name: March Through Keoland
215083.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

Excitement, glory, adventure and fame, or a mind numbingly, tedious, boring, interminable wagon-trip through the dusty roads of Keoland to deliver supplies on behalf of the kings agent. It’s all a matter of perception.

This is an introductory adventure based in the Kingdom of Keoland for character levels 1-4.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215084.name: A Little Reconnaissance
215084.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Adventure

From the introduction:

The Secretary of the Lady Regent of Cryllor needs you to do a little investigation of the humanoid troubles in western Cryllor. Sounds fairly easy, but these things always sound easier than they are...

An adventure for characters levels 1-4.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215085.name: Never Mined
215085.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A gripping tale of monstrous invasions, destroyed hopes, sour business deals, and lazy gnomes.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 4.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215086.name: All that Glitters
215086.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A sudden murder leads to an investigation in the City of Cryllor.

A roleplaying-intensive adventure for character level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215087.name: Evil in the Woods
215087.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Dreadwood Forest has never been a more dangerous place to be. Horrible monsters are ransacking caravans, villages are being raided and people are disappearing. Is it business as usual near the Dreadwood Forest, or is there something else, some other evil in the woods?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

215088.name: Death March
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215088.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Rumors of a disease have spread around Salinmoor leaving everyone on edge. With no way to escape your own demise, you leave on what may be your final journey to save yourselves from a horrible death.

This adventure is for characters level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215089.name: Warts and All
215089.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

"A lost village in the middle of the Hool Marsh?" That's bad enough, but why did you agree to go looking for it?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215090.name: Dreadfog
215090.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A heavy fog pours from the Dreadwood, forcing you into the dwarven town of Curget. Will you be able to survive?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215091.name: Pemlo's Lambic
215091.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It is rumored that no other brewer in Keoland can match the skills of the halfling Pembo Penchant. Many nobles, including King Skotti himself, covet the lambic Pemlo makes just once every four years. This year, the halfling needs your help.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

This is part 1 in the Good Hills Gone Bad series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215092.name: Fleeing the Scene
215092.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Yeoman ambassador who stirred so much controversy in Niole Dra has appeared in the town of Granforth. What is his true mission? Can peaceful relations between Keoland and the Yeomanry be preserved?

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

User summary:

See also YEO2-05: Fleeing the Scene.

215093.name: Down Trodden
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215093.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

More vile and unnatural creatures have been coming out of the Rushmoors of late, and the surrounding villages are fearful for their lives. Holphin Neheli sends out a call to the local adventurers to go into the swamp and find the cause of the undead hordes.

Part 2 in the Crowning Glory cycle, for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215094.name: Stuck in a Moment
215094.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Clues found in a destroyed caravan point to a town in trouble.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 10.

215095.name: Illegal Aliens
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215095.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Baron of Dilwych has commissioned you for an expedition into the Dreadwood. The Baron might be insane, and the Dreadwood might by deadly: a perfect combination for an adventure.

This is Part 1 of the "Dilwych" series.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

215096.name: Royal Rescue
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215096.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The cousin of the Viscount of Nume Eor has gone missing. Last reports have him headed into the Hool Marsh. The tiny village of Haven is located nearby, and the refuge for half-orcs and half-elves might be able to help find him.

A "Death in the Hool" adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

215097.name: Hunt in the Hool
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215097.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It is said that only wanted criminals and fools would venture into the Hool Marsh. When an escaped enemy of Keoland flees in to the Hool, heroes are sought to track him down.

An adventure for characters levels 1 - 8.

Part 2 of the Death in the Hool series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215098.name: The Tomb of Tloques-Popolocas
215098.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Gradsul Museum of Antiquities is exhibiting a rare Amedio treasure this evening: the newly discovered tomb of an ancient Olman holy ruler, Tloques-Popolocas. A dinner party is being held to celebrate its unveiling, and your presence has been requested.

A Keoland regional adventure for APLs 2-8 and Part One of the "Olman Retribution" series.

215099.name: Predators and Prey
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215099.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A strange light had reappeared in the depths of the Hool Marsh. Rumors abound: Lizardfolk have summoned an avatar of Sess’Innek; the Mad Mage Baltron has relit his beacon; agents of the Scarlet Brotherhood are establishing an outpost in the swamp. Or could it be something more sinister than anyone can even imagine?

A Keoland regional adventure for APLs 4-10 and Part Three of the "Death in the Hool" series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215100.name: Will of the People
215100.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Within the Earldom of Linth, generations of mixed-blood humans have long railed against the Suloise noble house that has oppressed them. Now, the Earl’s lands teeter on the brink of rebellion, and King Kimbertos has ordered a meeting between the Earl of Linth and the leader of his oppressed minority. Is this the first step towards peace – or war?

A Keoland regional adventure for APLs 4-12 and Part One of the "Linth" series.

215101.name: Of Witches and Warlocks
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215101.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

It is time for the annual meetings of the Craufield’s Mage Council and the pageantry that has grown up around it. Surely nothing can go wrong on such an occasion!

An adventure for characters levels 3 - 12.

This module is the third in the Crowning Glory cycle.

215102.name: Crimes of the Heart
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215102.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Scarlet Brotherhood has been delving into the Dreadwood and the Silent Ones want you to hunt them down.

A two-round Keoland regional adventure for APLs 4-10 and Part Two of the Barony of Dilwych series.

User summary:

This adventure is noted as "Premiere at ShoreCon"

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215103.name: Chain Reaction
215103.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

When a royal tax collector turns up dead in the streets of Cryllor the adventurers that find him are caught up in a series of events that no one could have anticipated.

An investigative adventure for APLs 4 to 14.

User summary:

This adventure is noted as "MEPACon Premiere".

215104.name: Old Secrets Never Die
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215104.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

"Wanted: An experienced reconnaissance and recovery team for a mission of national security. All interested and qualified parties should report to Viscount Richart Jorgos in Jaedrae." The Viscount grows more nervous by the day – it sounds like another of his missions into the Hool Marsh to report on the massing lizardfolk forces.

An adventure for APLs 4-12. This is the fourth module in the Hool Series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215105.name: A Little War: Prelude
215105.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Forces are mustering in the shadows of the Jotens under the command of a mysterious Suel mage. Towns in the county of Cryllor have been threatened; the village of Kilm has been razed. Now, savages raid the farmlands of the Good Hills Union. Questions must be answered. Who is this mysterious leader? What is the source of the raiders? And just how much is Pemlo’s stock actually worth?

An adventure for APL 2 – 12.

This module is the second in the Good Hills Gone Bad series

215106.name: The Castle Triskelion Mega-Dungeon: Inner Ward Second Floor
215106.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Another segment of the Castle Triskelion mega-dungeon is now available: the Inner Ward, Second Floor!

This module features 78 new encounter areas. No new monsters are introduced in this segment, but you’ll need to download the free New Materials Volume II, which features 30+ new monsters, new magic items, new mundane items, and new information about currencies of the realms!

215107.name: Fly! Kiwi!
215107.description:
It's serious! The earth was hit by a flood! Everyone is flying and running away! It's true!
However, there are still birds left behind on the ground!
What are you doing! Ostrich! Penguin! Kiwi! It's true! It's true!

Each player has a balloon card indicating the pattern of his country, turning one piece per turn and tying it to the straps that comes from his favorite animal.
If all the straps are filled with balloons, that bird will fly away, to the country of the most prolific balloons!
The kiwi has special abilities. Once you acquire Mr. Kiwi, that player can go for balloons in other countries once. So the second half of the game when each player owns a kiwi, is very thrilling!

215109.name: Kapibara Barabara
215109.description:
When Kapybara-san was playing outside, he was confused and became annoyed.
You have the tremendous ability to help him out!
Let's restore Kapybara-san!
What was the original figure like?

The game is about collecting capybara parts and
Players can take three actions.
· Moving
· Draw cards
· Use Capybara's special abilities
Please select 3 of these and act.

When Capybara returns to their original form, they will use their special special abilities to support them!
Even if you make a new creature, you only draw a special card once. Bonus points are also included.

The game ends once someone has trained six Capybara. The player with the highest score wins.
Using the capability of Capybara well disturbs other players.
Let's collect Kapybara-san sooner!

_________________________________________________________

どしーん★ぶつかってばらばらになってしまいました。

　カピバラさんたちがお外で遊んでいると
どっしーん★　ぶつかって
ばらばらになってしまいました。

そこへ通りすがったすごい能力を持ったあなた！
カピバラさんたちを元に戻してあげましょう！
あれれ？　元の姿はどんなだったのかなぁ？

概要
　バラバラになったカピバラさんたちを集めて錬成しよう！
　元の姿に戻ったカピバラさんたちの特殊能力を使ったり、新しい生き物を作ったりして、得点を競おう。

215110.description:
Kingdom of Aer: King Maker is a 2-5 player elimination assassination card game set in a Florentine fantasy realm. The King of Aer has died and each of the Great 5 houses must send their Royalty to the palace to see who is most worthy to become the new King. Along the road mayhem and treachery ensues as each family plots and assassinates the potential candidates'

KOA Kingmaker is played as a simultaneous action card game. Players play 1 card each turn from their hand face down to the table. Once all players have played their card the cards are revealed and the actions of those cards are resolved with various consequences.

Eliminate your opposition until there are only two players remaining. Each card is worth a different amount of points and the player with the most points from the final two players wins the game.
215110.name: Kingdom of Aer: Kingmaker

215112.name: Panic 64
215112.description:
From title screen
I.Gray
3: Up X: Down @: Left ArrowUp: Right SPC: Bomb

Drop the monsters to their deaths by blowing holes in the walkways. The bombs have a short fuse - do not get caught in the explosion! You score 50 points for each level a monster falls. As the game progresses, you must drop the monsters through more levels to kill them.

215113.name: Panic Planet
215113.description:
User Summary
Another Space Panic inspired game.

Cassette text
Dig monsters through the earth levels as they get stronger with each attack.

215114.name: Bug Blaster
215114.description:
Cassette descripion
Shoot everything that moves to collect points - spiders, mushrooms, centipedes, scorpions, dragonflies and snail.

User summary
Heavily inspired by Centipede

215115.name: Chartbuster
215115.description:
User Summary
Compilation of five games originally published by Alligata Software, Ltd

1) Blagger
2) Eagle Empire
3) Killer Watt
4) Panic Planet
5) Bug Blaster

215116.name: Little Dory Goes Home
215116.description:
Themed on Pixar's "Finding Dory" movie, help little Dory find her way back home by matching shells which become a path back to her parents!

Each player chooses a colored path. The shells are placed face-down on the board.

On their turn, a player chooses one face-down orange and one purple shell. If the pictures on the shell match, they are placed on the player's path. The winner is the first person to build a path to the home space.

Includes:
1 Game Board
48 Plastic orange and purple game shells
2 sticker sheets (stickers must be applied to each plastic shell)

215117.description:
Official card sleeves for the Myth board game.

There are standard-size sleeves for the Hero Cards (with images of the Heroes printed on the back), standard-size sleeves with the Myth flame, and small sleeves for the Item cards (different colours as well as with the Myth flame).

They are/were offered in the MegaCon games webshop and during their Kickstarter campaigns and are sold in packs of 50 sleeves.
215117.name: Myth: Card Sleeves

215119.name: Back Pocket Dungeon 1: Murder of the Maelstrom Queen
215119.description:
From the Introduction:

From time immemorial, the rulers of the mortal world have been counseled and tempted by capricious primordial spirits who rule over the elements. The greatest and most sinister of these was a half-kraken medusa known as the Maelstrom Queen, who sought to supplant the mortal races with her own line of immortal tentacled monstrosities. On the verge of her ultimate triumph, when the leviathans at her command rose from the depths, a legendary assassin murdered the Maelstrom Queen in her half-submerged palace with her own weapon. But the primordial mistress refused to let something as trifling as death put an end to her designs.

Every 13 years, she regenerates enough mystic power to rise again, and the world’s greatest heroes are sent to murder the
Maelstrom Queen once more.

215120.name: Back Pocket Dungeon 2: Vault of the Wyrm Prince
215120.description:
From the Introduction:

When the fires smoldered in the belly of an ancient red dragon tyrant, and his thirst had been slaked by the blood of countless innocents, the old wyrm made a deal with a succubus to spawn him a son and ensure his name would live forever. The demon held true, though she imbued the wyrmling with her own infernal blood. Those who fear and serve the abominable spawn of this pact know him as the Wyrm Prince. Cast into the abyss centuries ago by the legendary Three-River Paladin, the Wyrm Prince licked his wounds and recovered his strength. The Three-River Paladin has passed into legend, and the Wyrm Prince has resurfaced, his vengeance awakened along with his hunger. The Wyrm Prince sacked the high city Zhaldanis, slaying its people and claiming the greatest gift from the gods—the Soulstone. At this late hour, you must venture into the catacombs of the Wyrm Prince before the Soulstone loses its power and all mortal souls are damned.

215121.name: Tower of the Ascendants
215121.description:
From the Introduction:

The Voice of All spoke three times before falling into silence. The first time to give shape to the Ancients. The second to give them the world as their domain. The third to build the TOWER for the war that was to come.

And war did come. The Ancients, primordial warriors charged with protecting the world, were subverted by three great crusaders, vindictive and powerful. The Ancients were stripped of immortality and cast from the heavens to serve and suffer with the rest of humanity. The crusaders claimed new bodies for themselves, and became the Triumvirate, god-tyrants of all realms.

The long line of descendants of the Ancients is dwindling, along with humanity’s last hope. What few remain have gathered to enter the TOWER OF THE ASCENDANTS. Crumbling stone tablets of ages forgotten say that a mortal who ascends the TOWER that pierces the heavens and slays the gods who dwell in its highest bower will reclaim lost immortality.

215122.name: Colossus of the Shattered Moon
215122.description:
From the Introduction:

In what became known as the Age of Madness, an astral lich calling himself the Crimson Hand descended from the sea of stars, setting his fell gaze upon Gaea. Her red moon he made both his temple and his phylactery, and from there he sought to enslave those who would be ruled and devour those who would not. The Ancients of the four corners of Gaea united their knowledge against this threat, constructing a colossal golem, and inscribing the four POWER WORDS upon four scrolls. These scrolls they fed to the colossus, who ascended to the crimson moon in an instant. The sages of the realm watched as the flashes of battle signaled in the night sky, ending as the crimson moon itself split in half. The lich and the colossus were destroyed, and the Age of Madness was ended.

Millennia have passed, and now a new threat rises from the netherworld. The four POWER WORDS have been forgotten, lost among the shattered remnants of the moon. The sages have once again united what remains of their power, this time to teleport a paltry handful of crusaders to retrieve the lost scrolls before the world is doomed.

215123.description:
This Game 1 card was available to various game stores to be handed out during demos of the game.

This Spell carries the following ability:

Lose 1 [LIFE]; then gain 4 [INFLUENCE].
215123.name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Spell: Eye of Rabbit, Harp String Hum, Turn This Water Into Rum!

215124.name: AM2R: Return of Samus
215124.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Metroid II: Return of Samus.




AM2R, short for Another Metroid 2 Remake, is an action-adventure video game developed by Milton Guasti under the pseudonym DoctorM64, and released in August 2016 for Microsoft Windows, coinciding with the 30th anniversary of the Metroid series. It is an unofficial, enhanced remake of Nintendo's Game Boy game Metroid II: Return of Samus (1991), borrowing the art style and overall feeling of the Game Boy Advance game Metroid: Zero Mission (2004). Shortly after the game's release, Nintendo sent DMCA notices to websites hosting AM2R; download links to the game were removed from its official website, but Guasti said that he still planned to continue working on the game privately. In September 2016, Guasti ended the development of AM2R after he received a DMCA takedown request from Nintendo.

The game follows Samus Aran, who aims to eradicate the parasitic Metroids from their home planet SR388. It includes several new features, including redone graphics and music, a map system, and new areas and minibosses. The controls were changed to be more rigid, in line with the gameplay of later titles in the series. Video game journalists appreciated the game, frequently calling it impressive and commenting on the improved visuals compared to those of the original Metroid II, although one noted the win conditions in Metroid battles as being too precise considering how often they occur. The game was nominated for The Game Awards 2016, but was later removed from the nominations page without notice.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AM2R AM2R]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

215125.name: Hello Neighbor
215125.description:
Hello Neighbor is a Stealth Horror Game about sneaking into your neighbor's house and figuring out what he's hiding in the basement. Play against an advanced AI that learns from your actions.

Source: The Game Website.

215126.name: Don't fall in the Mead Hall: Allies and Drunk Guys
215126.description:
This is an expansion and requires the original game "Don't Fall in the Mead Hall."

This game includes a brand new Action Die that you may use instead of the original on your turn. It also includes a medium-sized bag so you can take the game anywhere with ease. This expansion brings in another table with 5 pawns so now you can play with a 5th player. Also included are 5 brand new Skál cards that you can add to your Skál deck (if you have it) and the optional Tipsy card deck.
In addition to the drinking, toasting and fighting of the original Don't fall in the Mead Hall, players now have a chance to sober up (passed out Vikings can wake up) by rolling the feast symbol. Every player will sober up by two (the drunk die will go down two). If you roll the turkey legs symbol your table sobers up by two and you choose another player to sober up by two. Vikings can now bring a sword and shield to the battle mat for a fight to the death. It's double the pain if you roll the new double "Skal!". Every tables drunk die will go up by two. Watch out because there's a chance Vikings at your table will get into a fight with each other if you roll the double fist. The Tipsy cards (optional, if you want to use them) add some extra mystery to each round and can make the game go faster. At the end of each round flip a Tipsy card and see if one of your Vikings can't hold his own.

The last table with at least one Viking standing wins.

215127.description:
Portable Sarcophagus
Type: Armor

Traits: Light Armor, Construct

Check to Acquire: Constitution / Fortitude 6

Powers:
Display this card next to your location and shuffle your token card into your location deck to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0. When your token is returned to the location, banish this card.

If proficient with light armors, you may recharge this card and a boon that has the Magic trait when you reset your hand.
215127.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – "Portable Sarcophagus" Promo Card

215129.name: Star Pirates
215129.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space Pirates

Vast fortunes are being made by extracting the many resources of the worlds of the Fringe, and doing so where there is little law and even less oversight from the otherwise watchful eyes of the governments back home in the Core Worlds. Yet, while vast sums of wealth are being traded back and forth, amongst the few, the vast bulk of the population out in the Fringe lives in abject poverty, sometimes even in slavery.

Vast fortunes existing with little law and oversight mixed with a dash of abject poverty for the many - it is a heady mixture. And one of the things that mixture produces is piracy. The allure of seizing a wealthy cargo and becoming instantly rich (or at least well-off for a time) succors many. And if they make the attempt, and survive the results, the dream can even become true. (Until the day the Star Marshals come knocking on your door, of course.)

While pirates are commonly known for being an independent lot, in actuality, a surprisingly large amount of the piracy that occurs is sponsored piracy. Of this, the most common type is corporate piracy - pirates given a free hand to seize as much as they can grab of all assets of the sponsor's rivals (whether rivals corporate, government, or civilian). And since in the Fringe, the corporations are oft the most sizable force of law in the region, not the government, that can wind up being a very free hand indeed. As long as you are caught somewhere where the sponsor has influence, that is, and not somewhere controlled exclusively by a rival power.

These corporate privateers may, from time to time, be tasked by the sponsor with seizing a particular cargo, but they are mostly given free reign to act as they normally would as pirates, except with an extremely favored list of people to hit (and a list of friends not to hit), with bonus pay for hitting certain targeted goals, such as taking X amount from a certain corporate rival and their agents.

However, privateers are far from the only pirates operating within the Fringe. On the other side of things are those awful individuals that have given piracy its feared reputations - the most depraved, the most foul in their deeds and action. Slavers, killers and kidnappers, these pirates are well-known for boarding ships in the deeps of space and raping, torturing, and killing all on board. They prey on small trade ships and transports, but have also been known to raid outlying outposts and colonies with equally brutal force and carnage. There are countless bands of these pirates, some as small as a few hard individuals, or as large as the Pirate Lords of the outer belts, with thousands of blackguards and hundreds of ships within their company. Some of these Pirate Lords have made such a name for themselves that they are even known by the common citizens back on the Core Worlds. Names such a Black-Eyed Pete and the pirate queen Morgan the Red-Handed. Others, though, are just nameless killers and raiders, seeking a quick path to riches within the backdrop of the hard life within the hard part of the galaxy that is the space frontier.

215130.name: Derby Duels
215130.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a derby duel, there are no officials, no fixed tracks, and no rules. There is only survival. And that is the question for this edition of Destruction Derby – when a brutal rival forces a derby duel out on the open road, who will be the ones to survive? ...Vengeance and derby duels in this, the final edition of Destruction Derby for this racing season!

215131.name: Entropic Heroes: Fantasy
215131.description:
From publisher blurb:

A myriad of fantasy options for the Entropic Gaming System!

Entropic Heroes: Fantasy is the third companion book to the EGS core rulebook, and provides a wealth of options for creating fantasy characters, settings, adventures, and campaigns! This book contains a collection of fantasy toolkits for filling your multiverse, along with providing many new fantasy options to the core mechanics. To avoid limiting GMs on their available options, guidance is provided for running all manner of fantasy games including epic fantasy, dark fantasy, fantasy horror, dying earth, and much more.

Entropic Heroes: Fantasy is for players and GMs and includes:

Fantasy Backgrounds (such as goblin, dragonkin, and satyr) with mechanics to create custom ones.
Fantasy equipment, including magic weapons.
Mechanics for many types of fantasy magic (such as arcane, divine, and runic).
Guidance on using these options in different fantasy settings.
A toolkit for building fantasy settings.
A toolkit for building fantasy adventures.
A collection of adventure frames.
… and much more!

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
215132.name: Escape from the Shrouded Fen
215132.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when a demon dies?

Oozing, scalding, deathblood floods the land, cursing it forevermore. Every seventeen years, the blood moon rises and the Fog Beast beckons villagers into the Shrouded Fen; those that follow never return. Now you have been chosen! Seeking ancient ruins, vast treasure, and arcane lore, you plunge deep into the mist-laden swamp. Plants impale corpses ravaged by man-eating birds, while specters of past victims roam the blood-cursed land. A mysterious floating portal defies entry, though the bog’s hidden artifacts are rumored to provide the key. Can you solve the riddles of the swamp and escape from the Shrouded Fen?

A 112 page digest-sized DCC adventure from Terry Olson that contains:

A 0-level funnel...
...Leading into a deadly 1st-level sandbox sandbox adventure
Incredible artwork from Benjamin Marra, and maps from Dyson Logos!
A host of random encounters and events to keep things interesting!
Notes to run the funnel and first level sections as stand-alone adventures




An additional 61 page letter-sized PDF appendix featuring:

Full-sized handouts
Author's notes
All the statblocks from the adventure for easy reference
A complete patron write-up with spell sheets
All the tables from the adventure to use as judge's screen inserts
The usual horde of Purple Sorcerer paper miniatures
All the maps from the adventure, both keyed and unkeyed
Every image from the adventure, many in both color and BW




Adventure in the deadly fen awaits!

215133.name: Stargazer Christmas
215133.description:
User Summary

They said Santa didn't exist, but I knew they were wrong.

215134.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells V (PRD)
215134.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

215135.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells V (3PP)
215135.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

215136.name: Coffin of Ashes
215136.description:
Delilah is an ordinary school girl who accidentally enters an old mansion on a rainy night. As her exploration in the mansion continues, she finds many mysterious phenomena that can't be explained. In this mansion covered by ashes, what's the secret hidden deep underground?

Source: The Publisher Website.

215137.name: Monastery of the Order of Grimkell
215137.description:
From publisher blurb:

Revered by many as a warrior-saint, no one knows that Grimkell began his career as a thief and bully. Evicted from the Hold for his crimes, he wandered the lands until chance placed him in between a young family and an angry dragon. In the first brave and selfless act of his life, he fought the dragon and managed to kill it, although he was mortally wounded. News of his deed reached his Hold, and whilst most residents were glad to hear of his passing, four young Dwarves were inspired, and formed the Order of Grimkell. Hundreds of years later, the Order continues, with only ever four members at any time. They work to uphold the virtues of sacrifice, generosity and defending the helpless. Grimkell would never have seen this coming...

Need a quick map for an encounter?
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depiciting a Dwarven monastery in a wintery mountainous setting. The central courtyard area is dominated by a large statue. The two buildings that flank the courtyard contain a dorm, library and scriptorium, kitchen, mess hall and weapons room. The courtyard is open at the end, looking out over the cliffs that protect the rear of the temple.

215138.name: Mystery in the Mindshatter (5E)
215138.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery in the Mindshatter is a supplement created for All Ages play using the popular Fifth Edition Fantasy (5e) system!

When King Chuckles, the faerie king of the realm known as the Mindshatter, goes missing, his daughter sends a servant to the humanoid lands to find heroes who may help locate the missing monarch. The characters must travel to the Mindshatter to meet with the Princess of Hmmph to learn the specifics of the assignment, and to begin their quest.

215139.name: The Morgen
rpgseries: Remarkable Races: Pathway to Adventure Edition
215139.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remarkable Races is going beneath the waves in a new series called "Remarkable Races Submerged." These new racial supplements will add an aquatic flair to our beloved Remarkable Races line, transforming many of your favorite races for use with the Cerulean Seas Campaign Setting, as well as introducing a few new ones.

Ever wonder what motivates the authors of Cerulean Seas? Well perhaps it's the enthralling morgen! Based on the Muse from Remarkable Races, we explore a congenial citizen from the Sea of Dreams who can coax any aquatic adventuring party to new levels of adventure. A vision come to life, these striking and peaceful pseudo-merfolk remove your fears, and draw you closer to your desires.

215140.name: Dark Hold Goblin Adventures
215140.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy games are filled with the magnificent exploits of mighty wizards, powerful warriors and god-fearing knights in armor.

Ours isn’t…

Dark Hold Goblin Adventures is dedicated to the small grovelling races which scratch out an existence in the dark catacombs through which other heroes stride like unto gods. Can you survive as one of a lost culture of Goblins living in the abandoned tombs of a long forgotten empire?

Dark Hold Goblin Adventures is a Savage Worlds compatible sourcebook allowing players and game masters to run a campaign revolving around low level goblin characters.

Inside you will find a detailed history of the Dark Hold campaign setting as well as new character classes and templates to use Goblins as player characters. There is also a short adventure to whet your whistle for the challenge of playing low level goblins in a world of high level dangers.

Are you up for it?

What’s Inside:

A detailed history of the Dark Hold Campaign setting
New character classes and templates to use Goblins as player characters
New Edges
New Creatures
An exciting starting adventure... Goblin Faire!
Crystal Smything
5 One Page adventures




..and much more!

215141.name: Brutal Doom 64
videogamehonor: 2016 The Game Awards Best Fan Creation of the Year Nominee
2017 SXSW Fan Creation of the Year Winner
215141.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Doom 64.




Brutal Doom 64 aims to continue this project of "porting" (actually recreating from scratch) Doom 64 to GZDoom and Zandronum engines. Unlike Doom 64 EX or Doom 64 Absolution the goal of this project is not to make a 1:1 port of Doom 64 for PC, but to enhance it in every possible way, bringing the satisfying gore and gunplay of Brutal Doom, new sounds and special effects that greatly enhances the oppressive atmosphere of D64, and attempting to include all the content cut from the original game due the cartridge space of the N64.

215142.name: Enderal: The Shards of Order
videogamehonor: 2016 The Game Awards Best Fan Creation of the Year Nominee
2017 SXSW Fan Creation of the Year Nominee
215142.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim.




Enderal: The Shards of Order has a country almost as big as Skyrim filled with new quests, dungeons, monsters, and fully voiced English-speaking NPCs (some by professional voice actors). While the starting area is a traditional green heartland full of bandits, wolves, rats, and spiders eventually I find a dangerous jungle and stranger locations like a town built on platforms suspended above a water-filled cavern, or the Whisperwood with its glowing trees and crystal formations. There are mountains and snow as well but it's more obviously varied than Skyrim, even if the suddenness of its geographical changes can be jarring. They've also tweaked some of Skyrim’s fundamentals.

Source: The Game Website.

215143.name: Dungeon Grappling
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
215143.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Live to grapple. Grapple to live.


Beowulf struggles with Grendel. Sinew parts, and the beast, now with only one arm, flees, mortally wounded.
The crocodile's mighty jaws close on an unsuspecting antelope, and with relentless force, drags it underwater to drown.
Gilgamesh and Enkidu's struggle is epic, shattering the walls of the surrounding buildings. With a twist and a bent knee by Gilgamesh, Enkidu is cast down. The two become fast friends and companions.
The giant scorpion seizes the mailed warrior in its powerful claw. At first, the metal mesh protects, but then with a mighty blow, the venom-filled stinger pierces the armor. A gasp, and then the struggle ends.
The assassin lightly leaps into the air, wraps her legs around her target's neck, and flings him to the ground. She rises, a dagger buried in his neck.


From the first story ever told, to tales on the silver screen. Gilgamesh and Beowulf. Hunting cats and giant scorpions. They all have at least one thing in common: they engage in one of the oldest forms of combat on the planet. Dungeon Grappling delivers that to your tabletop, for editions including OSR-based, the PFRPG, and 5e.

215144.name: Carcassonne: Solovei Razboynik and Vodyanoy
215144.description:
Каркассон: Солове́й-Разбо́йник & Водяной (Solovei Razboynik and Vodyanoy) is a little expansion (2 tiles) for Carcassonne, made by the Russian editor of the Carcassonne game (Hobby World) and was a present for the participants of the Russian national Carcassonne league 2016.

One tile represents Solovei Razboynik "Nightingale the robber" from the Russian folktale "Ilja Muromez". The second tile represents Vodyanoy, a kind of ghost, only living in water.

Solovei Razboynik
If followers occupy a Road that goes through the Solovei Razboynik tile (or they occupy Roads that are connected to that tile later on in the game), players must move them onto the tile. The followers then remain on the tile until the end of the game. In his turns, instead of placing his follower, the player may return 1 follower from the Solovei Razboynik tile into his supply.

Vodyanoy
When a player places this tile adjacent to one or more tiles on the board, all followers from the adjacent tiles are moved onto the Vodyanoy tile. Followers remain on that tile till the end of the game and get 2 points minus.

215146.name: Yulemas
215146.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's the day before Yulemas in the small mining town of Phandalin. However, the children are worried that a local woman called Santana Clausen isn't coming this year with present for them. A group of adventurers is sent out to locate her. This lead them to a religious game of life and dead. Will the adventurers be successful and save Yulemas? Only time will tell.

This is a holiday inspired adventure optimized for five characters starting at level 1.

215147.name: Huddle Up!
215147.description:
Huddle Up! is a game for 2 players, ages 7+

The aim of the game is to get the most penguins in your color in a huddle, as pieces of the ice flow, they are standing on break away!

Materials
Hex Board with 37 spaces
36 pawns or cubes, 18 Black and 18 White, representing the player’s penguins

Setup
Place the board between the players.
Next starting at the top row, place a penguin one to a//////////// space, alternating Black then White while skipping the center space on the board.

Definitions
Group – Adjacent penguins of either color are considered a group and a single penguin with no adjacencies are also considered a group.

Play
One Player plays Black the other White.
Decide who starts, turns then alternate.

On a turn,
• Move a penguin away from your starting position, 3 spaces in any of the 6 directions, avoid moving over empty spaces or the center space.

• You must end your move on a space occupied by 1 or 2 penguins.

• You must move if you can, otherwise, you must pass

• No more than 3 penguins in a space.

• If you land on a space occupied by 2 penguins, and one of the 2 penguins is a friendly penguin, your opponent’s penguin is bumped off and removed from play.

If a group is split into 2 groups that is divided by empty spaces, the smaller group is removed from play.

If a group is split into two or three equal size groups, remove the group/groups that do not have the penguin that caused the split to occur.

The game ends when both players pass.

Scoring

Majority controls a space

Total the number of penguins controlling a space.

1 - Friendly Penguin on a space = 1 point
2 - Friendly Penguins on a space = 2 points
3 - Friendly Penguins on a space = 3 points

Spaces controlled by both players are not scored

Objective
Player with the most penguins in the largest connected group in his color, wins

215148.name: Green Man
215148.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Green Man CR 8
Possessed Tree CR 7
2 New Magic Items: Foliate Mask, Green Man Ornament
New rules for Herbal Remedies

215151.name: Cthulhu Insanity Dice
215151.description:
Cthulhu Insanity Dice comes with two different dice. One has green tentacles and is used for immediate effects when a character is traumatized and suffers a temporary insanity (the Temporary Insanity die). The other has red tentacles and is used for longer term phobias (the Phobias die).

In the 6th and 7th editions of Call of Cthulhu, an investigator suffers a temporary insanity when they have suffered 5 or more sanity points at one time and passes their idea test. Afterwards, a mild phobia is applied to the investigator. For other game systems, apply an insanity or phobia when the rules apply some mental trauma or when a character loses control of their actions, such as failing a fear test. The duration of the insanity should be proportional to the horror the character is facing; the more terrifying, the longer it should last.

(taken directly from dice literature)

215152.name: Dungeons and Dragons and Philosophy: Read and Gain Advantage on All Wisdom Checks
215152.description:
Back cover blurb:

Does justice exist in the drow city of Menzoberranzan?

How does one cope with the death of a player character?

Is it ever morally acceptable to cast necromancy and summoning spells?

Is Raistlin Majere the same person over time?

Do demons and devils have free will?

User summary:

A volume in the Blackwell Philosophy and Pop Culture Series (the entire series mostly is comprised of non-gaming content).

215153.name: GEARGUNS - Tank Offensive
215153.description:
The alien enemies came from distant stars; they were like insects in a metal shell! They were hiding on the dark side of the Moon, waiting for the teleportation and the occupation of our Earth! An artifact which Gear Guns Squad managed to get hold of was the source of energy for the teleportation. The primary goal of the squad is to destroy the alien enemies on the Earth and destroy the teleport on the Moon!

Your main task is to defend the Earth against an all-out alien invasion. Using alien beacons, the enemies are trying to call the prime evil. The player will have to capture the enemy beacons during a certain time period. To stop the alien invasion, keep the enemy beacon before its destruction. In the Survival Mode you will also face the progress of enemies, different enemy bases, bonuses for destroying enemies, battles with huge bosses, and etc.

Source: The Game Website.

215154.name: Junglila
215154.description:
Each player in Junglila is a daring explorer, progressing through the secret lands of the jungle in search of the fabled lands of the village of gold. However, the jungle is full of obstacles to overcome, and
moving forward blindly will be a fatal endeavor. With your trusty dice, you need to acquire food, wood, and a variety of tools and resources to use in your journey. You also need letters to grant you abilities along the way that allow you to change your dice, exchange artifacts, and gain various benefits. Who will be able to reach the storied village of gold and earn the most fame to become the explorer of legends?

215155.description:
This third installment in the Space Infantry series takes the core concept of an elite squad of veteran sci-fi soldiers fighting through random obstacles to reach an objective, using only the tools they bring with them and what they can scrounge from the environment to a new level. Main additions are co-op play, dice, and "node" cards.

The chit-based random number generation system has been replaced with physical dice. Static maps have been replaced with randomized locations on a set layout. Nodes towards a mission goal still exist but are no longer printed on the mission sheet. Instead, a deck of “node” cards are drawn and placed on an 11 x 17 map sheet as mission progresses. To further customize the experience, the “node deck” can be split into specific encounter types such as zero – g, Hazardous terrain, science facility and so on.

Space Infantry: Resurgence also brings together every module, both by LnLP and by the game’s developer, including New Worlds, Hordes mode, Steele Bones, and The Last Outpost with new components, systems, and artwork.
215155.name: Space Infantry: Resurgence

215156.description:
Gawi Bawi Bo is a strategy game for 2 players ages 8+

For ages 8+
30 min play time

You move and capture tiles following the Rock, Paper, Scissors rules.

Setup
Place board between the players

Shuffle the 36 tiles face down

Tiles are placed on empty spaces of the board

In turn, flip over and place a tile on an empty space, starting with the outer edge spaces. Then work your way towards the center leaving the center space empty.

You are now ready to play

Stacking Order
A Rock tile can be stacked onto a Scissor tile

A Scissor tile can be stacked onto a Paper tile

A Paper tile can be stacked onto a Rock tile

Play
Players share tiles

Play Rock, Paper, Scissors to determine the starting player

Turns then alternate

On a turn,

Move a tile from 1-3 spaces in any of the 6 directions, not over empty spaces or the center of the board. Then following the Stacking Order end the move on top of another tile capturing it.

Both tiles are removed from the board, they will be used at endgame scoring

Groups
Adjacent tiles are considered a group, a single tile with no adjacencies is also considered a group.

If a group is split into 2 groups that are divided by empty spaces, the smaller group is removed from the board.

If a group is split into 2 or 3 equal size groups, remove the group/groups that did not have the captured tile.

These tiles are not used in scoring.

When no more moves can be made the game ends

Scoring
Total your tiles using the numbers on the face of the tiles

Runs of two or more tiles only count as the lowest value in the run, like (23,24,25,26)

Subtract any (-1) tiles you may have from your total

Objective
The player with the lowest score wins!
215156.name: Gawi Bawi Bo!
boardgamefamily: Children's Game Print and Play Contest

215157.name: Contamination Principle
215157.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Special Exploratory Team for the Tomorrow Legion, on patrol in the Oklahoma Territory, hears a short range radio signal crackle over their equipment. A man’s voice fades in and out through the garbled transmission: “…sighted Xiticix…Red River…before it’s too late…Valiant…” Then the broadcast ends.

Just how far will you go to be a hero to the town of Valiant?

215158.name: Hope, Entwined
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215158.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Recent events in the Viscounty of Nume Eor and the Hool Marsh Protectorate have drawn the attention of King Kimbertos Skotti himself. A venerable sage and a captured Brotherhood monk may hold the answers to a blossoming hope for Keoland, or serpentine plots may strangle Keoish interests in Nume Eor and beyond.

A Keoland Regional adventure for APLs 2-12 and the fifth and final installment in the “Death in the Hool” series.

215159.name: Active Imagination
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215159.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A soul of evil comes closer to its twisted plan with every beat of its heart. In a dementation of a man’s innocent dream, death and danger stalk the innocent. In sanity, a former madman finds no peace. How will they come together to decide the fate of the Barony of Dilwych?

A Keoland Regional adventure for APLs 2-12, and the third and final scenario in the Dilwych series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215160.name: Lasting Deeds
215160.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Disturbing rumors of missing persons and strange figures moving around at night have been filtering out of the Duchy of Dorlin. A rain of evil begins to fall within the borders of Keoland. The PCs must stand against the trickle, or it will rain, rain hard, and flood so that all they hold dear will be washed away.

A Keoland Regional adventure for APLs 4-12, and Part Four of the Crowning Glory Series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215161.name: The Rain, the Wind, and the Night
215161.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The unsolved murder of a Royal Explorer lingers over the port city of Gradsul like a miasma. Powerful political factions seek your help to close the books on this crime before its ramifications hurl Gradsul into a night so black it may never see the dawn. But which side holds the key to true justice?

A Keoland regional adventure for APLs 2-12, and Part 2 of the Olman Retribution Series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215162.name: A Last Dance at Midnight
215162.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A puppet of dark forces, the daughter of the Earl of Linth spins and leaps in an empty hall. Within her family’s ancient manor, she steps to unheard music and dances with unseen others. How does the magic upon this child threaten the fate of the Empire? And why is her family unable – or unwilling – to help? Can you end her midnight dance? This is the second module in the Tales of Linth series.

A one-round adventure for character levels 4-12.

This module focuses heavily on role-playing and investigative elements.

User summary:

A one-page PDF "Notes and Errata" document was issued for this adventure.

215163.name: Knights of Futures' Past
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215163.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Check your weapons and armor at the door, because it’s festival time in grand old Gradsul. Veterans and neophytes alike put on their colorful costumes to partake of the Ball of the Red Masque, a feast fit for heroes where adventurers and their tales are told and toasted... though not necessarily in that order.

A Keoland regional adventure for APLs 6-16, and Part Two of the “All Good Things” series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215164.name: In the Footsteps of the Fallen
215164.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Visitors usually find the Good Hills Union a bit odd, but harmonious. Well, it’s not all Lambic and Chicken Cake. What festers beneath the pastoral surface?

A Keoland regional adventure for APLs 4-12, and the final installment of the Good Hills Gone Bad Series.

215165.name: For Want of a King
rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215165.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Chaos reigns in the Kingdom of Keoland; the King has been assassinated and the Oeridian heartlands have erupted into civil war. Even as opposing forces begin to form battle lines, House Neheli ponders that which has occurred. It would seem that the die has been cast for the fate of the Lion Throne – or has it?

A Keoland regional adventure for APLs 2-6, and Part Two of the “All Good Things” series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215166.name: Twisted Chaos
215166.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Shortly after the victory at Steffenmoor, evil is unleashed from within the depths of the ruined city, wreaking havoc upon the occupying soldiers of Keoland. Hundreds are dead, while survivors have been mutilated by magic that twists both body and mind. Strange creatures now roam the flooded streets of Steffenmoor, and the burden of discovering the nature of this new magical threat has fallen to the National Academy of Wizardry – and a few heroes.

A combat intensive Keoland regional adventure for APLs 4-12, and Part Two of the Sakatha Returns! series.

rpgseries: KEO - Living Greyhawk Keoland Regional Adventures
215167.name: Closure and Disclosure
215167.description:
